name: Sage (Dried)
properties: Aromatic herb from the mint family (Salvia officinalis)
Dried form is more concentrated than fresh
Rich in rosmarinic acid and other antioxidant compounds
Traditional culinary herb with earthy, slightly peppery flavor
Used in Mediterranean and European cuisine
Contains vitamins K, A, C, E, and B vitamins
Provides minerals including calcium, iron, and magnesium
benefits: May help reduce inflammation throughout the body
Supports oral health with antimicrobial properties
May help regulate blood sugar levels
Adds savory flavor without salt or fat
synergies: Pairs with thyme in grain loaves and savory baked dishes
Combines with nutritional yeast for umami depth
Works with mushrooms in gravies and sauces
Complements whole grains like barley and oat groats
amount: 1/2 to 1 teaspoon dried sage per recipe serving 4-6 people
